physical_appearance: "The image shows a photograph that is in black-and-white. It is rectangular and it features a group of people in a coffee farm. Three rectangular farm beds can be seen and there is an individual in each one of them, using a hoe to separate and spread the coffee beans out. There are others who are watching and talking to one another. There is a farmhouse at the back, and trees in the background. ""Drying the coffee 127"" is stated in white at the lower right hand side of the photograph. "
sgcool_label_text: This is an original photograph from G R lambert & Company that shows the process of drying the coffee.
subject_terms_1: coffee (food, dye) farmers (people in agriculture) farming (function) farmhouses indigenous people
subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Coffee Harvesting Farmers Farmhouses Indigenous people
